snippet: The ensemble, whose average age of its audience is dropping, is planning only 16 performances next season, down from 28 last season.
abstract: Little Orchestra Society, part of New York City's music scene since 1947, reinvents itself to survive economic difficulties; plans, which calls for name change to LOS New York, includes cutting number of performances, scrapping two programs, introducing new program for ages 3-7 and seeking orchestra partner with own performance venue.
lead_paragraph: The ensemble, whose average age of its audience is dropping, is planning only 16 performances next season, down from 28 last season.

headline.main: The Little Orchestra Society Limits Schedule and Aims for Younger Audience
headline.print_headline: Orchestra Cuts Back and Aims Younger
